noun.description: A North American Indian settlement of the southwestern US, especially one consisting of multistoried adobe houses built by the Pueblo people.
A member of any of various North American peoples, including the Hopi, occupying pueblo settlements chiefly in New Mexico and Arizona. Their prehistoric period is known as the Anasazi culture.

adjective.description: Relating to or denoting the Pueblos or their culture.

proper noun.description: An industrial city in south central Colorado, on the Arkansas River, at the foot of the Front Range of the Rocky Mountains; population 104,951 (est. 2008).

origin: Spanish, literally people, from Latin populus.
